Dear Manoranjan,

I hope you're doing well. Following our conversation on LinkedIn, I am writing to formally express my strong interest in the SDE 3 - Backend position at Slice.

As mentioned, I have 5.9 years of experience in backend development with a strong focus on Java, Spring Boot, and microservices. Given my experience and career aspirations, I am confident in contributing effectively to your team.

Job Link: https://jobs.smartrecruiters.com/slice1/743999999575475-sde-3-backend-

Highlights of My Experience:
1. 5.9 years of backend development experience, specializing in Java, Spring Boot, and Microservices Architecture.
2. Proficient in building scalable, high-performance systems and API-driven services.
3. Migrated a monolithic fintech system to microservices architecture, improving scalability and performance by 50%.
4. Experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB) and messaging systems like Kafka.
5. Hands-on with multithreading, collections, and system optimization techniques.

Please find my resume and portfolio for your review:
Resume: https://gopalaswamy.me/#/resume
Portfolio: https://gopalaswamy.me

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of discussing how my experience can benefit Slice.

Warm regards,
Mushini Gopala Swamy

userQuestion: Techstack you have worked on?
modelAnswer: I have worked on Java, Spring Boot, AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, EKS, SQS, SNS, CloudWatch), Apache Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, JavaScript, Node.js, ReactJS, Redis, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL, OracleDB, Python, REST APIs, Git, JIRA, Postman, LangChain, LLMs (Mistral, CodeLlama), Ollama, Microservices Architecture, and Distributed Systems.

userQuestion: Tell us about your HLD, LLD Working experience in projects
modelAnswer: I have hands-on experience in designing High-Level Design (HLD) and Low-Level Design (LLD) for multiple projects. In my E-commerce integration project, I worked on designing scalable APIs and backend systems to handle large transaction volumes. In my EOD (End of Day) project, I helped migrate a monolithic application to a distributed microservices-based system, improving performance and reliability. I have also pursued a specialization course from Scaler Academy focused on DSA, HLD, and LLD, which strengthened my design and problem-solving skills.

userQuestion: Do you require sponsorship to work in India?
modelAnswer: No, I am authorized to work in India.

userQuestion: Will you be interested to work abroad? like US or canada
modelAnswer: Yes, I am definitely interested in opportunities to work abroad, including in the US or Canada. While I am authorized to work in India, I would require sponsorship for employment visa status in any other country.

userQuestion: Tell me about the best project you have worked on
modelAnswer:
One of the best projects I worked on was the EOD (End of Day) processing system for a FinTech platform. Initially, the system was a large monolithic application that faced performance issues while processing huge loan transactions daily. I was involved in redesigning it into a scalable, distributed microservices-based architecture using Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, and MongoDB. This helped in significantly improving the system's reliability and processing speed.

My main role was to work on the system's High-Level and Low-Level Design (HLD, LLD), build REST APIs, handle database optimizations, and set up event-driven communication between services. I also worked on Dockerizing the services and deploying them to cloud infrastructure. Overall, this project gave me strong experience in system design, scalability, and working with distributed systems.

userQuestion: Tell me the project you have developed using Python
modelAnswer:
I've developed a few AI-focused projects using Python:
AI-Powered Document Filtering: Led the development of a document filtering solution where users can retrieve documents using natural language queries (voice or text). I used Python with 
Mistral NeMo 12B and LangChain to generate filter JSONs based on these queries.
LangChain AI Agents for EDI: Designed AI agents using LangChain that understand EDI business terms and convert natural language queries into MongoDB queries for aggregated document metadata insights.
AI Instagram Memer: I built a web-based meme generator using OpenAI APIs, allowing automated meme creation and posting to Instagram via APIs.
CodeExpert Tool: Created an AI-powered VS Code extension offering code assistance using Code Llama LLM and AWS SageMaker.

userQuestion: elaborate it full
modelAnswer:
Okay, here's a more detailed breakdown of my work experience:

**Rocket Software (Feb 2022 â€“ Present):**

As a **Senior Software Engineer**, I've been involved in designing and developing various solutions, including:

*   **Automated Billing System:** I designed and implemented an automated billing system, which replaced manual processes and resulted in significant time savings (120+ hours per quarter) and a 95% reduction in billing errors. This also led to an 80% improvement in customer satisfaction due to real-time billing insights.
*   **Cloud-native API Integration Platform:** I engineered a platform for integrating with e-commerce platforms like Shopify and Amazon Marketplace. This automated order fulfillment and reduced manual intervention. I also developed adaptable Lambda connectors to onboard new platforms quickly.
*   **AI-Powered Document Filtering:** I led the development of an AI-powered solution that allows users to retrieve documents using natural language queries. This involved fine-tuning LLM models and using technologies like LangChain and MongoDB.
*   **LangChain AI Agents for EDI:** I designed AI agents that can understand EDI business terms and convert natural language queries into MongoDB queries for aggregated document metadata insights.

**Pennant Technologies (Jun 2019 â€“ Feb 2022):**

As a **Software Engineer**, I contributed to various aspects of their FinTech platform:

*   **Monolith to Microservices Migration:** I played a key role in migrating the EOD loan processing system from a monolith to a microservices architecture. This involved using Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, and Kubernetes, and resulted in a 50% performance improvement.
*   **High Resiliency System Enhancements:** I worked on making the system more resilient through database partitioning, SQL optimization, idempotent processing, retry mechanisms, and DLQ implementation.
*   **EMI Payment Receipts Interface:** I developed an interface for generating EMI and partial loan payment receipts, which was integrated with a real-time notification system.
*   **Bulk Receipt Upload System:** I designed and optimized a feature for uploading and processing up to 10,000 payment receipts at once, using multithreading to improve efficiency by 65%.
*   **Core Banking Modules:** I contributed to the development and enhancement of key banking modules like NPA management, TDS automation, and consumer durable loan workflows.

Throughout my experience, I've focused on building scalable, high-performance systems and have gained expertise in various technologies like Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, AWS, ReactJS, and more. I'm passionate about solving complex problems with technology and am always eager to learn and grow.

You can also visit gopalaswamy.me for additional details.
